input_text:
Job Title: Maintenance Manager

Location: Pleasant Prairie, WI

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Manufacturing

Description:
Maintenance ManagerPleasant Prairie, WISalary - $110,000 -$120,000 + bonus 
The Maintenance Manager directs all Engineering efforts to ensure plant Quality, Efficiency, Safety and Financial goals are met or exceeded as directed by Plant Manager. Resource and Department management:Manage all Resources to ensure the operations meets production goals at budgeted cost.Maintain and Manage inventory to ensure most cost-effective equipment up time is maintained.Identify required spare parts and appropriate min and max levels for inventory.Maintain and manage contacts with outside vendors and contractors being main point of contact.Effectively report up budget attainment and contributing factors.Understand cost drivers within the budget and seek improvements in cost reduction.Develop Capital Projects to meet company goals and ensure reliability of plant operations.Manage both Capital and Non-Capital project to ensure project meet objectives on budget and on time.Develop and monitor KPI’s to ensure the department stays on track to meet plant goals.Develop and maintain accurate reporting to be presented to management team.Develop effective corrective actions to all down time and waste events.Improve the Preventive Maintenance processes within our PM software.Monitor and evaluate equipment to access effectiveness of PM program.People and Organization:Build and manage a team including Supervisors, Leads, Clerks, and Technicians to achieve plant objectives.Provide and ensure effective leadership, performance management, and skills development for all department personnel.Ensure all personnel are adhering to company policies including food processing regulation and safety.Set and maintain clear expectations for department personnel.Maintain all necessary documentation to ensure department and plant maintains complianceManage all safety activities for the department including but not limited to training, program development, machine specific LOTO, equipment evaluations, ext.
RequirementsSkills and Qualifications:Bachelor’s Degree is preferred.Minimum of 5 years’ experience with maintenance, as well as people management.Food manufacturing experience is preferred.Proficient in mechanical and electrical troubleshootingEffective problem-solving skillsPLC troubleshooting preferredFamiliarity with safety procedures for a vast variety of equipment and machines

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level

output_json.title: Maintenance Manager
output_json.summary: Maintenance Manager directs Engineering efforts to ensure plant Quality, Efficiency, Safety, and Financial goals.
optional_skills: Proficient in mechanical and electrical troubleshooting
Familiarity with safety procedures for a vast variety of equipment and machines
job_responsibilities: Manage all Resources to ensure production goals are met at budgeted cost.
Maintain and manage inventory to ensure maximum equipment uptime.
Identify required spare parts and appropriate inventory levels.
Maintain and manage contacts with outside vendors and contractors.
Effectively report budget attainment and contributing factors.
Understand cost drivers within the budget and seek improvements in cost reduction.
Develop Capital Projects to meet company goals and ensure plant reliability.
Manage both Capital and Non-Capital projects to ensure they meet objectives on budget and on time.
Develop and monitor Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) to ensure departmental alignment with plant goals.
Develop and maintain accurate reporting for management team.
Develop effective corrective actions for downtime and waste events.
Improve Preventive Maintenance processes within PM software.
Monitor and evaluate equipment to assess the effectiveness of the PM program.
Ensure all personnel adhere to company policies including food processing regulations and safety standards.
Set and maintain clear expectations for department personnel.
Maintain all necessary documentation to ensure department and plant compliance.
Manage all safety activities for the department.
